channel.title: Uncategorized on JASMIN Help Site
channel.description: Recent content in Uncategorized on JASMIN Help Site

item.title: MobaXterm (windows terminal client)
item.description: Windows users are strongly recommended to connect to JASMIN using the freely available MobaXterm This article provides information about: Downloading and installing MobaXterm Basic usage Setting up MobAgent to store your private key Additional features Versions of MobaXterm   The instructions given below are for version 23 of MobaXterm.

item.title: Requesting resources
item.description: This article explains: How projects and resources are managed How to access the JASMIN projects portal How to create a project to record resource requirements (for a new project) How to join an existing project, by invitation from another user How to invite another user How to request additional resources for an existing project How projects and resources are managed   Resouces on JASMIN, such as storage and compute, are allocated to science communities separated into “consortia”.

item.title: Acknowledging JASMIN
item.description: We strongly encourage users to acknowledge JASMIN in all research outputs that have used the JASMIN facility. The acknowledgement statement should be:

item.title: Processing requests for resources
item.description: This article is for consortium managers and explains: The overall process and role of consortium manager How to process a request for new resources for a service, submitted by a project How to process a request for additional resources on an existing project’s service Introduction   Please make sure you have read the article “Requesting resources” to understand how the process works from the requester’s point of view.

item.title: Approving requests for access
item.description: Managers of JASMIN resources will also be set up to approve applications from members of the JASMIN user community wishing to use particular resources.

item.title: Working with many Linux groups
item.description: The number-of-groups limitation - and how to work around it Description   On JASMIN, users are added to Linux groups for access to the group workspaces and CEDA datasets which they have registered to use, in addition to a couple of standard groups granted for all users.

item.title: JASMIN Conditions of Use
item.description: Please refer to the JASMIN Terms and Conditions of Access

item.title: Article under review
item.description: The article which you are trying to access has been removed for now, pending reorganisation of the JASMIN documentation and training materials.
